Articles.Content: <figure class="tmblr-full" data-orig-height="92" data-orig-width="480"><img src="http://36.media.tumblr.com/d20fbf85ecd92526c094206d1e52bcfa/tumblr_inline_nxzfxsMQiR1rr2wit_540.jpg" data-orig-height="92" data-orig-width="480"/></figure><figure class="tmblr-embed tmblr-full" data-provider="youtube" data-orig-width="540" data-orig-height="304" data-url="https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3Dpoi4JVhu1iQ"><iframe width="540" height="304" id="youtube_iframe" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/poi4JVhu1iQ?feature=oembed&enablejsapi=1&origin=https://safe.txmblr.com&wmode=opaque" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe></figure><p>Another short KSP cinematics by Niemand303, this one is a routine mission to Mir-2! #KSP It’s awesome! <br/></p>

Wow, great video. Now this is a question I've been meaning to ask for a long time. How did the Energia compensate for the offset CoM with the Buran on its side? The Buran had no engines to fire through its CoM.

Yay! Glad to see it here! :)

[quote name='Motokid600']Wow, great video. Now this is a question I've been meaning to ask for a long time. How did the Energia compensate for the offset CoM with the Buran on its side? The Buran had no engines to fire through its CoM.[/QUOTE]

[URL="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RD-0120"]RD-0120[/URL] and [URL="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RD-170"]RD-170[/URL] have a pretty good gimbal range, which allows to account for CoM changes throughout the flight. :) Edited November 18, 2015 by Niemand303
Ah yes! This is featured in the Tantares page!

[quote name='Niemand303']Yay! Glad to see it here! :)



[URL="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RD-0120"]RD-0120[/URL] and [URL="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RD-170"]RD-170[/URL] have a pretty good gimbal range, which allows to account for CoM changes throughout the flight. :)[/QUOTE]

Hmm... I just cannot wrap my head around that. I guess the Buran was much lighter so its offset wasnt as bad, so... yea. I just cant help but think that even with a large gimbal range the Energia with the Buran crabbed all the way to orbit.

[quote name='Motokid600']Hmm... I just cannot wrap my head around that. I guess the Buran was much lighter so its offset wasnt as bad, so....[/QUOTE]

Fully loaded, the Buran was in the region of 100 tons, IIRC. The gimbal range and performance of the engines really is just fantastic! :)
